reactor.io.net.http

Class HttpServer<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.io.net.ReactorPeer<IN,OUT,HttpChannel<IN,OUT>>
      • reactor.io.net.http.HttpServer<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - The type that will be received by this server
    OUT - The type that will be sent by this server
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NettyHttpServer

    public abstract class HttpServer<IN,OUT>
extends ReactorPeer<IN,OUT,HttpChannel<IN,OUT>>
    Base functionality needed by all servers that communicate with clients over HTTP.
    Author:
    Stephane Maldini

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public Promise<Void> start()
        Start the server without any global handler, only the specific routed methods (get, post...) will apply.
        Returns:
        a Promise fulfilled when server is started

      • getListenAddress

        public abstract InetSocketAddress getListenAddress()
        Get the address to which this server is bound. If port 0 was used on configuration, try resolving the port.
        Returns:
        the bind address

      • route

        public HttpServer<IN,OUT> route(Selector<HttpChannel> condition,
                                ReactorChannelHandler<IN,OUT,HttpChannel<IN,OUT>> serviceFunction)
        Register an handler for the given Selector condition, incoming connections will query the internal registry to invoke the matching handlers. Implementation may choose to reply 404 if no route matches.
        Parameters:
        condition - a Selector to match the incoming connection with registered handler
        serviceFunction - an handler to invoke for the given condition
        Returns:
        this

      • get

        public final HttpServer<IN,OUT> get(String path,
                                    ReactorChannelHandler<IN,OUT,HttpChannel<IN,OUT>> handler)
        Listen for HTTP GET on the passed path to be used as a routing condition. Incoming connections will query the internal registry to invoke the matching handlers. e.g. "/test/{param}". Params are resolved using HttpChannel.param(String)
        Parameters:
        path - The HttpSelector to resolve against this path, pattern matching and capture are supported
        handler - an handler to invoke for the given condition
        Returns:
        this

      • post

        public final HttpServer<IN,OUT> post(String path,
                                     ReactorChannelHandler<IN,OUT,HttpChannel<IN,OUT>> handler)
        Listen for HTTP POST on the passed path to be used as a routing condition. Incoming connections will query the internal registry to invoke the matching handlers. e.g. "/test/{param}". Params are resolved using HttpChannel.param(String)
        Parameters:
        path - The HttpSelector to resolve against this path, pattern matching and capture are supported
        handler - an handler to invoke for the given condition
        Returns:
        this

        Listen for HTTP PUT on the passed path to be used as a routing condition. Incoming connections will query the internal registry to invoke the matching handlers. e.g. "/test/{param}". Params are resolved using HttpChannel.param(String)
        Parameters:

        handler - an handler to invoke for the given condition
        Returns:
